author: News 3 Staff
title: chevron-right
text: {p}Sunny skies & breezy weather are in the forecast Thursday ahead of a strong weekend storm...{/p}{p}As of this morning, Lee Canyon is reporting 16” of new snowfall in the last 24 hours with a total season snow amount of 20.5”, so far. The National Weather Service is also reporting 7” of snow from the last storm at 6,582 ft in Lovell Summit, 10” around 7,046 ft in Kyle Canyon & 11” totals at 8,626 ft, 8,890 ft and 7,860 ft in elevation on Mt. Charleston.{/p}{p}TODAY: We're waking up to a few clouds this morning with wall to wall sunshine anticipated this afternoon. High temperatures will climb a bit higher compared to yesterday, reaching 58 degrees in Las Vegas, 53 degrees in Summerlin & around 59 degrees in Henderson.{/p}{p}Winds will be out of the north 10-20 mph with wind gusts around 30-35 mph. The strongest winds will happen in the northwest valley today.{/p}{p}Air quality is ranked 'good' and pollen levels remain low.{/p}{p}TONIGHT: Skies will go from clear this evening to partly cloudy overnight with valley low temperatures dropping to the mid and upper 30s. Winds will also gradually back down through the evening to northwest breezes 5-15 mph.{/p}{p}YOUR 7 DAY: A storm system will move in over the Intermountain West region with little impact expected locally. Breezes will pick up slightly on Friday afternoon in the valley around 5-15 mph with wind gusts up to around 20 mph.{/p}{p}Our next weathermaker is a much stronger storm diving south over the weekend. It looks like this storm will mostly be a wind event for our area. Weather models aren't completely in sync with the movement of the next storm but show the potential of more mountain snow on the way with an estimated 2\"-4\" additional inches of snow on the mountains. There's also a slight chance the valley could see some showers ahead of the strongest winds on Sunday but the odds stand at 20% as of now. Wind gusts on Sunday are expected to be between 30-40 mph with temperatures cooling into next week.{/p}{p}Valley highs will remain in the low 50s at the start of the work week with overnight lows near the freezing mark... this means with the winds blowing temperatures will feel like the upper teens to low 20s on Monday morning!{/p}{p}Beyond the 7-day, daytime highs appear to stay in the upper 40s to low 50s with another chance of stormy weather NEXT Friday into Saturday.{/p}{p}- Chloe Koast{ }{/p}{p}The cast of Fantasy is hosting a special New Year's Eve show.{/p}{p}Abby Sullivan, Ashton Bray, and Gigi joined us in the studio to talk more about it.{/p}{p}Sunny skies & breezy weather are in the forecast Thursday ahead of a strong weekend storm...{/p}{p}As of this morning, Lee Canyon is reporting 16” of new snowfall in the last 24 hours with a total season snow amount of 20.5”, so far. The National Weather Service is also reporting 7” of snow from the last storm at 6,582 ft in Lovell Summit, 10” around 7,046 ft in Kyle Canyon & 11” totals at 8,626 ft, 8,890 ft and 7,860 ft in elevation on Mt. Charleston.{/p}{p}TODAY: We're waking up to a few clouds this morning with wall to wall sunshine anticipated this afternoon. High temperatures will climb a bit higher compared to yesterday, reaching 58 degrees in Las Vegas, 53 degrees in Summerlin & around 59 degrees in Henderson.{/p}{p}Winds will be out of the north 10-20 mph with wind gusts around 30-35 mph. The strongest winds will happen in the northwest valley today.{/p}{p}Air quality is ranked 'good' and pollen levels remain low.{/p}{p}TONIGHT: Skies will go from clear this evening to partly cloudy overnight with valley low temperatures dropping to the mid and upper 30s. Breezes will pick up slightly on Friday afternoon in the valley around 5-15 mph with wind gusts up to around 20 mph.{/p}{p}Our next weathermaker is a much stronger storm diving south over the weekend. It looks like this storm will mostly be a wind event for our area. Weather models aren't completely in sync with the movement of the next storm but show the potential of more mountain snow on the way with an estimated 2\"-4\" additional inches of snow on the mountains. There's also a slight chance the valley could see some showers ahead of the strongest winds on Sunday but the odds stand at 20% as of now. Wind gusts on Sunday are expected to be between 30-40 mph with temperatures cooling into next week.{/p}{p}Valley highs will remain in the low 50s at the start of the work week with overnight lows near the freezing mark... this means with the winds blowing temperatures will feel like the upper teens to low 20s on Monday morning!{/p}{p}Beyond the 7-day, daytime highs appear to stay in the upper 40s to low 50s with another chance of stormy weather NEXT Friday into Saturday.{/p}{p}- Chloe Koast{ }{/p}{p}The cast of Fantasy is hosting a special New Year's Eve show.{/p}{p}Abby Sullivan, Ashton Bray, and Gigi joined us in the studio to talk more about it.{/p}
